storyInfo: Milliarium's remaining city units reorganize themselves into a great wall, stopping the tide of Seaborn coursing towards land. The Waterway Program may have failed, but Ægir's Waterways open up once more in an unprecedented manner.

attributes.content: *cough*—
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: Phew. That woman nearly got me—
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: C-Cassia? I've been looking for you forever! Where'd you run off to earlier?
Lucilla?
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: What are you doing here, child?
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: The city unit framework needs servicing; it's a standard combat duty. But... look at the beacon tower... What happened inside the city?
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: The Seaborn have broken into Milliarium. That tower has become one of their nests.
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: Leave this to me. You should get out of here, quick.
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: It's too risky. I'll stay here with you.
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: No need to—Urgh.
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: Are you hurt?!
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Cassia
Lucilla
attributes.content: It must have been the Seaborn as you came over—

attributes.name: Lucilla
attributes.content: Wait, no, a scratch like this couldn't be left by a Seaborn...
attributes.joined: It must have been the Seaborn as you came over—Wait, no, a scratch like this couldn't be left by a Seaborn...

attributes.content: Did someone attack you?
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: *cough*!
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: Wait, why are you pulling out the safety valve?
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: Hey, don't push it! It'll cut off the ground level self-diagnostic system, and the city framework will stop working—
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: No, you know that way better than I do...
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: You've been trying to do this all along, Cassia? Are you... with the Church of the Deep?
attributes.name: Lucilla
Lucilla
attributes.content: When the Sea Patrol investigated Tullia, you deliberately turned them against her? Don't tell me it was you who made her disappear—

attributes.name: Lucilla
attributes.content: What's this you've put on my neck?
attributes.joined: When the Sea Patrol investigated Tullia, you deliberately turned them against her? Don't tell me it was you who made her disappear— What's this you've put on my neck?

attributes.content: Longbeard combtooth grass. Something made by a friend in charge of raising road-side coral. Don't move. You'll die if its bristles pierce your skin. Quite painfully, if I may add.
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: Now—*cough*—Leave this place, child. Once it senses you've gone far enough, it'll fall off by itself.
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: You want to leave, don't you?
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: To be honest, before we became coworkers, I happened to see your assessment at the Institute of Development Planning.
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: You care so much about that data scientist because you've never forgotten that evacuation of Milliarium, have you?
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: You watched as the distant lights of the volcanic power station went out, surrounded in endless darkness, with only strange rumbles and rustling carried to you by the currents...
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: The ocean as it once was.
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: At that very moment, you were the closest to the ocean out of all of Milliarium. You, standing at the mezzanine of the dome, all alone.
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: The IDP assessment was that there was too great a psychological burden, which is why they agreed to transfer you from the dome system to ground level. Your so-called 'fear of heights' was just a little joke of yours.
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: I'm afraid that you yourself don't even realize what lies deep within your heart.
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: The remaining Seaborn will soon discover that this route is still open. You wouldn't want to meet them again.
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: Go, quickly, before it's too late.
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: Cassia grips the safety valve and continues to push it. She no longer looks at the joke-loving colleague by her side.
The valve stops abruptly, releasing an ear-piercing shriek. She can push it no further.
A pair of slender hands are pushing back from the other side.
Lucilla?
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: Hah, in any other situation, I'd definitely give you a piece of my mind, or stuff this whatever-grass into my ink bottle and tell you this sort of practical joke is beneath you.
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: But it's so bright... the light from where the tower sank in, from the dome above us... Every Seaborn on the whole continental shelf is rushing towards Milliarium, right?
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: Just what is behind those strangely colored lights?
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: You're not wrong, Cassia. The Seaborn have eroded away at our lives. I've experienced the truth of that myself, and I'll never forget.
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: I envied Tullia. Our experiences were so similar, but she was able to protect what she treasured all along. An amazing woman, really!
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: And look at me, I escaped the dome and got back to the ground. Before you arrived, I was even thinking of escaping from here, too.
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: But where would I go?
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: I can't let you break the framework, Cassia. I can't let the Seaborn get into any other Milliarium's unit, even if this grass thing kills me in the process!
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: Because... Because there's no going back for me.
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: *cough*...
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: You really are strong, child.
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: Laurentina's parents once told me that while the dome may be beautiful, this transparent structure is actually the true eye of the city.
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: In fact, I've been asking myself recently... Since we're at war right now, shouldn't the eye be on the lookout for danger?
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: She forces herself to look ahead, the strange colors reflecting in her pupils. The roar of the tides and the whispering of the ocean's progeny resound in her ears.
The young Ægir presses hard against the safety valve. She does not let go. She dares not let go.
Only once a firm hand presses down on her shoulder, forcing her stiff muscles to relax, does she come back to her senses.
You can let go now, Lucilla.
attributes.name: Secunda

attributes.content: Cassia, she...
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: Temporarily paralyzed. I only managed to graze her with my shot, which is why the paralytic took so long to take effect.
attributes.name: Secunda

attributes.content: Sorry for putting you at risk.
attributes.name: Secunda

attributes.content: This is Consul Clementia. Citizens of Milliarium, heed me!
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: Once the city unit containing the beacon tower has been fully ejected, the rest of the city shall break through the Seaborn encirclement and move towards dry land!
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: Reactivate the linkage mechanism in the city's framework and perform a structural reorganization. Force fields at full power! We'll stop the Seaborn tide from setting a single tentacle onto land!
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: Legions VIII and X, along with the Sea Patrol: send all operational warships out in turn to escort the city!
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: It might be more appropriate if you were the one to handle the report regarding Cassia, Lucilla.
attributes.name: Secunda

attributes.content: I see. You should be heading straight to the port now. The mission just declared by the consul is more urgent.
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: Cassia's already subdued. I'll take her to a doctor first, and then... she should be punished.
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: And if the city is going to undergo structural reorganization, the dome system will be the focal point of the force field to hold off the Seaborn. So they could probably use some extra hands up there...
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: Maybe I should submit an urgent application to return to my old post.
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: You're very brave, Lucilla.
attributes.name: Secunda

attributes.content: Oh, so you heard all that earlier...
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: I did. Before you submit that application though, you ought to see a doctor yourself. Longbeard combtooth grass does in fact contain a potent neurotoxin.
attributes.name: Secunda

attributes.content: Ah. Right, I will.
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: Ramming armor, check. Ship cannon mounts, check. Monitors, check. Camouflage coating, check. Propulsion system, check. All system diagnostics complete, ready to launch.
attributes.name: Battleship Pilot

attributes.content: We'll be heading to the designated waters at full speed to block the Seaborn tide from the north.
attributes.name: Battleship Pilot

attributes.content: All weapon system permissions granted. No need to hold back. Don't let them get near Milliarium.
attributes.name: Port Administrator

attributes.content: We'll do everything we can.
attributes.name: Battleship Pilot

attributes.content: You're just part of the first sortie. We'll be sending the rest of our ships into battle after you.
attributes.name: Port Administrator

attributes.content: You're to escort Milliarium in shifts while it's reorganizing, serving as an extension of its 'Great Wall' and preventing the Seaborn from making landfall.
attributes.name: Port Administrator

attributes.content: So remember, the moment you get the order to change shifts, you must return to resupply immediately.
attributes.name: Port Administrator

attributes.content: Understood.
attributes.name: Battleship Pilot

attributes.content: Seaborn spotted!
attributes.name: Port Administrator

attributes.content: The remaining Seaborn in the city are attacking the port! Do not let them approach the warship docks!
attributes.name: Port Administrator

attributes.content: (Pained convulsions)
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Not content with ambushing us in their nest, they made a sneak attack on our city, too?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: ...How annoying.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: (Rapidly flaps fins)
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Wrapping around a statue? What, have the Seaborn developed a taste for art since entering the city?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: That said, the Sorrowdrinker is hardly a masterpiece, so I won't feel too bad when I've reduced it to rubble.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Honestly, I think it's got more charm with an arm broken off.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Thanks for the glowing review, Skadi. Are you feeling better now?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Yeah, ever since we left the nest.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Good to hear.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: It's the Hunters!
attributes.name: Port Administrator

attributes.content: The Abyssal Hunters have safely returned to the city!
attributes.name: Port Administrator

attributes.content: Swordfish.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Captain Gladiia, you've met...
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: I saw him.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: We've arrived at the right time. You must have heard Secunda's report over the emergency frequency.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Infiltrating Milliarium, breaking into the beacon tower's control room, murdering the weapons technology advisor of the Waterway Program, and finally, choosing to return to the ocean with the Seaborn.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Ulpianus has not made it easy to clear him of suspicion.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: To capture him, or even execute him is a duty we Abyssal Hunters must perform in the future.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Captain Gladiia...
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: But for the moment, our mission is to search for the remaining Seaborn scattered around the city units, and put every last one of them to the sword.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: ...What must be said, I have said.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: You've avoided answering the question at the heart of all this, Mártus.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: The question... at the heart...?
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: From your description, everything that transpired beneath the ruins, the crimes you committed and the consequences incurred... They all seemed to stem from some mysterious 'inevitability.'
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: But the Mártus I know was an eccentric yet gifted man. He was doubtful by nature, and not one for making arbitrary decisions.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: He would not have rashly discarded all reason and played at being the mystic. And he would have been even less inclined to reject his own existence, or ignore the worth of others.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: The choices I have made, the outcomes I have borne.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Why do you care what the past Mártus thought, before he made his decision?
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: His past choices have made you who you are now. Without understanding his reasoning, we cannot understand your existence.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You would care about such trifles as well, Kal'tsit?
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: (The nuclei within its skull spin)
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: I understand now.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Of course you would care. How could you not?
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: The human that once ate the strange flesh experienced such struggle, too. Was it a day, or perhaps several? In the depths of the ruins, time holds no measure.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: He feared. He doubted. He was compelled to think over every possibility.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Where will the next crisis come from? When will it descend upon Terra? He used a lifetime of knowledge to attempt to decipher the undecipherable, to comprehend the incomprehensible.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: If there exists a lifeform that could survive the cosmos of quietus, even if only as a singular being, how would it be born?
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Given infinite time, even the tiniest fin will be able to type out the ultimate truth of all things on a terminal using its tail. But time was our most precious resource.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Admittedly, the Feranmut before him had foreseen our ruinous prospects, but could He and His progeny continue bearing the torch of life through it all?
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Supposing they could, before they instinctually iterate a way of overcoming that destruction in a limited time, how large a population and how efficient a fecundity would they require?
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Would they have to consume a patch of sea? A whole planet? An entire star system? How many must die to support their lives?
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Supposing they could not, then where did the true answer lie? On the other side of the ocean? On the other side of the sky? Or perhaps it is somewhere out in the sea of stars, untouchable by Terran hands?
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Even if you spent your entire life simulating, you would not have been able to obtain a definite conclusion.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The information you possessed was simply insufficient to calculate every possibility.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Indeed, Kal'tsit. But the past Mártus had no choice but to try.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Danger and possibility both hung above his head, while below his feet he found only an unseen tightrope.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: You could have informed your country from the start.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: Ægir would have helped take on your burdens. The oldest records of the Academy of Science could verify the past you saw. The latest inventions of the Academy of Technology could model the future you envisioned.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: To cede the choice to others. Is that a solution, or an escape?
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: The choices of the countless many against the choices of the few. Are they more accurate, or more ambiguous? More earnest, or more capricious?
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Suppose the means for life to continue is not civilization, and the species that transcends ruin is not humanity. If so, how would Ægir react?
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Enough, Mártus.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: If you had thought of every possibility and foresaw the bitter price to pay, then your final decision is even more inexcusable.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: No, Ægir, I do not mean to defend my choices.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: What I wanted to say was that, at the time, there was an immature lifeform that interrupted my flights of fancy.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Its tentacles were minute, and its body yet uncoordinated. Beneath its translucent membranes, simple organs could be clearly seen.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Born from Ishar-mla, it had unknowingly crawled past the cabin wall, and was licking my ankle happily.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Was it unaware of how swiftly its death would come?
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Did it not know that it was destined to become one of those insignificant dots among the millions of bio-signatures on the monitor?
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Being the progeny of a Feranmut, could it have not seen the frightful vision its parent saw? Was it unaware that the destiny of its entire race was only to foretell and greet ruination?
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: It just wriggled calmly towards its foreordained destruction, acting out of instinct only.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: As for us, there are countless possibilities to consider before making a decision, countless trade-offs to worry over.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: We find ourselves unable to ignore the costs of our decisions, or the results, or the value and meaning of those results.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Humanity, glub—Humanity is ever a prisoner of itself, ever one step behind 'fate.'
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: This is the essential difference between humanity and the Seaborn. This is why they are suited to bear the duty of continued existence.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.options: That's why you ate the strange flesh?;That's why you became like this?;That's why you interfered with civilization's evolution?

attributes.content: If there is any life that can survive that future of quietus, no matter what form it takes...
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: It is worth fighting for, no matter the cost.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: 'There is no justice here. Only the path ahead.'
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: You should understand now why you must help we many evolve.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: You are not the first one the Doctor and I have seen who can barely qualify as human, but they all made their hard choices.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: No one had ever made a choice as horrifying as yours.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Before you ate that flesh to become a Seaborn, you had already renounced thinking as a human does.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: From my perspective, that which you abandoned in your final moments—your doubts, misgivings, concerns, and struggles—were the most precious of treasures.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The Seaborn are swallowing Terra's life whole. You have not denied this, nor can you stop it. How are we to see them as our hope?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: What is your choice then, Kal'tsit? To incubate Originium?
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: The collapsed stargate, the extinguished sarcophagi... Of the countless failed plans, is Originium the only one still in operation?
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Stones amidst the land and sky, ever silent. They are an incurable disease, harming life atop dry land.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: And yet, they are a plan left by the prehistoric civilization, one expected to save all existence at the very end... In ways incomprehensible to the average person.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Glub—The stairwell to survival can only be forged in the fires of destruction.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: No. Such destruction must not happen.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Much like Caerula Arbor, Originium at some point turned to the annihilation you speak of. It changed in ways none can understand, and none can reverse.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: And since it has changed, it must now be stopped.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Whatever the case, using life to feed life or ruin to beget ruin would only serve to remove all meaning from survival.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: ...Kal'tsit. Or rather, AMa-10 from the records. You surprise me.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: You and I should have arrived at the same conclusion via different paths. No. You should have been even more rational, more decisive.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: I merely noticed a spark of the prehistoric civilization and took on its mantle. You, however, were born for this task. You held aloft its torch eons before I did.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: You have kept watch over their distant aspirations and legacies. You have carried out your assigned mission. You witnessed changes. You bore loss... No human could have toiled for as long as you have.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: But now...
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Has endless 'life' rendered you feeble, Kal'tsit? Has it turned you human?
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.options: Kal'tsit has always been like this.;You don't know Kal'tsit at all.

attributes.content: Was it... because of this one?
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Dr. {@nickname}, or rather... Oracle?
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Many facilities, many doors, your fingerprints, face, voice... Within the cerulean cave, among the ruins... traces of you lie everywhere.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: You have visited the depths of the abyss before.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.options: Have I?;A pity I don't remember...

attributes.content: I recognized you. I have been speaking with Kal'tsit until now only because it is more efficient.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: You must know the truth. Your visitation is sure to have meaning. Perhaps you are able to explain why the project is at a standstill.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: But your title is different now; something has happened to you. Otherwise, Kal'tsit would have held no doubts about what had happened to the plan.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: For several reasons, the Doctor is unable to remember many of the things back then.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: (The nuclei within its skull spin)
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: 'Memory loss'... Glub, unsurprising.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Losing one's memory is perhaps the most insignificant sacrifice you could make.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Even the most resilient of life cannot withstand the ravages of tens of thousands of years. The fact that you still exist upon Terra is in itself a miracle.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: What I saw, what He saw, what They saw. Those frightful visions are an absolute truth to you.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: You have lost your proud civilization and homeland. Heaven and earth have lost all color. Time and space have become vast prisons.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: You have been exiled by despair. You have stopped to rest upon Terra. You have not escaped your fated ruin... All men will perish, all things rendered meaningless.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Despite this, you have not stopped fighting for hope. This planet has been forever marked by your resistance... Even if those marks are mostly wreckages.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: I revere you and your cause. You, the people of a bygone age.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.options: A Seaborn acknowledges my past?;If that 'cause' involves today's Seaborn...;Maybe the project stalled because they realized the cost.

attributes.content: Dr. {@nickname}, whether you accept it, deny it, or are undecided, it matters not to me. I am not hoping to win your understanding.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: I seek not your approval.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: You, and your comrades, had planted hope in the depths of the sea. A possibility. A spark.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Perhaps you have forgotten it. Perhaps you have renounced it. Perhaps you now stand against it, come what may. Now, it is I who tends to this light. And I shall not see it extinguished.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: The rejection of our flame's kindler will not waver the many's resolution.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Let's stop trying to prove ourselves. We shall return to the reality itself.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: We many sense the oncoming crisis. Perhaps the eye beyond the clouds has caught a glimpse of Terra's exceptionality, a sword hanging above all our heads.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Terra is but a cage, trapping countless souls unaware of the truth.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Now there is a crack in the bars. A crisis, also an opportunity.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Sight. Sound. Smell. Touch. The rushing of the ocean waves.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Within the cage that is Terra, the children of the sea are the most resilient race. Never have they stopped evolving.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: You cannot deny that We Many have become the most magnificent of miracles. They will become the sparks in the wake of the Big Bang, the seeds from which the cosmos will blossom once more.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: They are the closest to... success.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Tell me, Kal'tsit, Dr. {@nickname}, and the Ægir...
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Do you now choose humanity, Originium, or the Seaborn?
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: It is true that a crisis fast approaches. There are still many questions I am unable to answer. Many truths I am unable to grasp.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: But this does not imply that life can be reduced to a hollow concept. That would simply erase its original meaning.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You consider this a weakness, Mártus. I consider it my drive, bestowed upon me by this endless life of mine.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: Life's worth should be determined by the living.;Life's meaning should be written by the living.

attributes.content: The Seaborn are a calamity that must be stopped.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: On this, the Doctor and I will not change our positions, and neither will Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Without civilization, how can you speak of survival?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Without survival, how can you speak of civilization?
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: This ridiculous debate has gone far enough, Mártus.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: We have excised the diseased organ from Milliarium. Your 'kin' in the city are being eliminated as we speak.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: You'll have plenty of time to reflect on what you've done and share the rest of your secrets with us in prison.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: (Furious howl)
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: You, Ægir, and that ebon monster...
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: It is futile to contain me. You alone, your city alone, are not enough to slay me. To slay Ishar-mla.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: The city has completed its reorganization. I can imagine how it will look as it bars our current, but we many will surpass it.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: There is no right or wrong here. So let your brief resistance provide our soundest proof.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Next, I will rouse the slumbering Firstborn. I will lead our kin to the moons.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: You will become a part of this magnificent cycle, Kal'tsit. As will you, Dr. {@nickname}.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Maestro.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Su Santidad, I am here to make my report.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: No need. Ægir has already informed us of what transpired beneath the waves.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: What of Kal'tsit and the Doctor of Rhodes Island?
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: They're still in the city.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: We're connected, sir.
attributes.name: Inquisition Clerk

attributes.content: Th-This is...?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: A real-time image of the sea's surface. All thanks to Ægir's drone matrix projecting directly onto the great lighthouse's display.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: The Seaborn tide and the Ægirian city, both approaching the land. They're less than ten nautical miles away.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: That stirring spray, those intertwined currents... Are they all... Seaborn? Even the color of the seawater has changed...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: That's only the portion exposed to the surface. The tip of the iceberg.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: The Seaborn took advantage of Ægir's landfall. This entire sector of sea has become their nest.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: Ægir's defensive perimeter... How long can that transformed city of theirs hold?
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: I do not know.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: Have we come to the conclusion that Ægir's Waterway Program has failed?
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: All the Ægir in Milliarium are still fighting as hard as they can.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: For the past two months, the Penal Battalion has requisitioned all operational vessels along Iberia's coast. They've been on standby in Gran Faro, and are now ready to set sail.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: I will personally lead them to reinforce Ægir's defensive perimeter. Together, we will stem the Seaborn tide.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: I'm afraid you won't have much time to rest, Irene.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: It seems not. I saw the Inquisitors in formation at the base of the lighthouse earlier.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: In the end, Iberia has found herself walking a tightrope with no margin for error.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Survival, or utter destruction. There are no other paths before us.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Should Ægir's great wall fall, it will be up to us to educate the Seaborn on the significance of land, and the price they must pay for desecrating it.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: M-Maestro! Doña Irene!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: You stay here, Jordi.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: This lighthouse will be our final bastion. The Penal Battalion's operations will depend on its signals. Do what you can to keep it going.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: No, not that—
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Look out the window.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: ...Light.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Is that... a lighthouse?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: But aren't we at the only operational Eye of Iberia?
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: What's going on? Why are we suddenly receiving so many identical signals?
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: The lighthouses along the submerged coast, which have sat in silence for more than half a century...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: They have all lit up at once!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: ¡Dios mío!
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: The silent technology of the Islanders... What are you responding to?
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Ulpianus hears the rumbling of the city reorganizing above his head as he watches the lightless beacon tower slowly sinks into the depths.
The building that once supported the grand aspirations of his people is now a Seaborn brood nest.
The old and feeble will use their bodies as nutrients for the next generation. Their journeys will continue with their newborn kin.
This is how the Seaborn have always been. They spare nothing in their devotion to their kin, and do their utmost to nurture them.
The thought brings a brief moment of sickness to Ulpianus.
The weight of the great anchor in his hand stretches to his shoulder. The moment he realizes that he will never be recognized or remembered, he feels more clear-headed than ever.
He is yet unable to cut the disgusting connection between himself and the Seaborn, but he still has the strength to cut off the tide surging towards the city.
Gladiia was right. Battling in the rapidly proliferating nest might only hasten his assimilation. All that awaits him is death, or worse.
Ulpianus puts all his might into swinging his anchor.
As if able to read his thoughts, the tiny hatchlings gracefully avoid his swing before calmly flickering past the grip of his anchor. He adjusts his breathing, recalculates, and swings once more.
(Faint mechanical cry)
attributes.name: Newborn Lifeform

attributes.content: An immature lifeform, freshly hatched, flits across Ulpianus's vision. It flips over gracefully, revealing minute yet precise mechanical structures in its belly for just a moment.
Then there are two, then three. The school of newborns link together into a fine path of light, illuminating the chaotic waves.
Adult Seaborn of all shapes crowd around them tightly, directing the currents and protecting them as they swim into the distance.
What are you escorting, Seaborn? What is it you're protecting?
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Nutrients.
attributes.name: Stopping Seaborn

attributes.content: Life.
attributes.name: Stopping Seaborn

attributes.content: Kin.
attributes.name: Stopping Seaborn

attributes.content: And you, Ul-pianus.
attributes.name: Stopping Seaborn

attributes.content: We many, together as one...
attributes.name: Stopping Seaborn

attributes.content: As a former consul of the Academy of Technology, one at the top of his field, Ulpianus is certain he is not mistaken. The steady flow of wondrous things streaming out of the beacon tower...
Are nanomachines once ensconced in there. A history cut off. A dream that died young.
As an Abyssal Hunter, he trusts his sense of smell as much as he does his scientific intuition. Their scent is no different from the Seaborn.
Those 'beacons,' dead in the cradle nearly two hundred years ago, now thrum with new life. Incubated by the Seaborn, they now swim together towards the tidal confluence on the surface.
Have you not yet given up on these games, Ægir, despite your own noose around your neck? Or is this also a part of your plan?
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: At first, there was only a mote of fluorescence.
Then, a flowing line.
And after that, an elegant lattice, spreading out across the surface of the sea.
Billions of nanomachines sway alongside the children of the sea, bobbing up and down on the ocean waves.
Their shimmer is minute yet clear, indistinct yet unwavering. The passage of light reflects about among the Seaborns' bodies.
The currents connect every nest scattered across the seas. Seaborn gather together from every corner of the ocean for their excursion onto land, gracefully extending the paths of light.
They intertwine with one another. The golden net they weave is like a galaxy strewn across the sea's surface, from Milliarium down into the deepest depths of the ocean.
The Waterway. The network of the ocean, one connecting land and sea, one transcending chaotic space and placid time.
Bound together with We Many.
